Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed (fired reddish and very worn) below; part of rosette and lotus flower in added white outline with trace of added red; exterior: band of vertical strokes at rim above key maeander frieze between pairs of dilute lines; below, part of pendant lozenge and rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1592) (phase 2)
